aws::graph::propositions: # Financial Statement Preparation Estimates and Assumptions
The preparation of financial statements in conformity with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) requires estimates and assumptions.
Estimates and assumptions affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities in the consolidated financial statements.
Estimates and assumptions affect the reported amounts of revenues and expenses in the consolidated financial statements.
Estimates and assumptions affect the related disclosures of contingent liabilities in the consolidated financial statements.
Estimates and assumptions affect the related disclosures of contingent liabilities in the accompanying notes.
Estimates are used for income taxes.
Estimates are used for useful lives of equipment.
Estimates are used for commitments and contingencies.
Estimates are used for valuation of acquired intangibles.
Estimates are used for valuation of goodwill.
Estimates are used for stock-based compensation forfeiture rates.
Estimates are used for vendor funding.
Estimates are used for inventory valuation.
Estimates are used for collectability of receivables.
Estimates are used for impairment of property and equipment.
Estimates are used for impairment of operating leases.
Estimates are used for valuation of investments.
Estimates are used for impairment of investments.
Estimates are used for self-insurance liabilities.
Estimates are used for viewing patterns of capitalized video content.
Actual results could differ materially from these estimates.
The company reviews the useful lives of equipment on an ongoing basis.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

text:
###### Use of Estimates

The preparation of financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related disclosures of contingent liabilities in the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes. Estimates are used for, but not limited to, income taxes, useful lives of equipment, commitments and contingencies, valuation of acquired intangibles and goodwill, stock-based compensation forfeiture rates, vendor funding, inventory valuation, collectability of receivables, impairment of property and equipment and operating leases, valuation and impairment of investments, self-insurance liabilities, and viewing patterns of capitalized video content. Actual results could differ materially from these estimates. We review the useful lives of equipment on an ongoing basis.
